messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Musical Theater
messages.messageBody:
<<<<I carried the book around the bookstore for an hour, trying to decide.
Not sure if it has any content different than the dvd's. At least I got
some exercise!! (It weighs about 10 pounds, I think.)>>>>

According to a segment on KCRW the book does indeed contain extra material,
and the DVD's contain 5 or 6 hours more material than the TV presentation.

Robyn L. Coburn

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Musical Theater
messages.msgSnippet: ... I carried the book around the bookstore for an hour, trying to decide. Not sure if it has any content different than the dvd s. At least I got some
messages.messageBody:
On Oct 25, 2004, at 12:59 PM, Paula Sjogerman wrote:

> In fact, I think we're getting the
> DVDs, CDs, and the book.

I carried the book around the bookstore for an hour, trying to decide.
Not sure if it has any content different than the dvd's. At least I got
some exercise!! (It weighs about 10 pounds, I think.)

I'd be interested to know whether it seems to be just a print version
of the dvd's or if it has additional material - let me know after you
guys spend some time with both!!

-pam
National Home Education Network
<www.NHEN.org>
Serving the entire homeschooling community since 1999
through information, networking and public relations.

messages.subject: Musical Theater
messages.msgSnippet: on 10/25/04 2:49 PM, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com at ... We re getting these for Zoe for Hanukah. In fact, I think we re getting the DVDs, CDs, and
messages.messageBody:
on 10/25/04 2:49 PM, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com at
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> And I suppose some people wouldn't see Rox as a success story, because
> she puts nearly all her time and energy into musical theater and some
> would see that as too one-dimensional or something. Last night I bought
> her the boxed set of dvd's of Broadway: the American Musical -- which
> recently showed on PBS. The DVD's have, of course, hours of extras. It
> was $60 and my friend was surprised I'd spend that on such a thing.
> Would somebody hesitate to pay that for an advanced astronomy series
> for a kid who was into rocket science? They'd think that was a bargain.
> <BEG>


We're getting these for Zoe for Hanukah. In fact, I think we're getting the
DVDs, CDs, and the book. And we don't have a lot of extra $$ these days. We
LOVED the series and honestly, I can't figure out why everyone wouldn't see
why knowing about the history of musical theater is just as important as the
history of the Depression or the labor movement. It IS part of the history
of those things anyway.

Now my list of movies to see is so much longer though......

Paula
